history.comment: Shift to "located on" and expand time periods

references.formattedCitation: Hurwit, Jeffrey M. The Athenian Acropolis: History, Mythology, and Archaeology from the Neolithic Era to the Present. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2001.
Hurwit, Jeffrey M. The Athenian Acropolis: History, Mythology, and Archaeology from the Neolithic Era to the Present. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2001.

description: The temple of Athena Parthenos located on the Acropolis of Athens, which was constructed at the height of Athenian power between 447 and 432 BCE. It is the largest Doric temple in mainland Greece.

properties.description: Polygon representing the boundaries of the Parthenon structure, derived from an OpenStreetMap Way.
properties.title: OSM location of the Parthenon

history.comment: @thomase checked and added references provided by @bkiesling
update WHL, add TGN 8713152: Parthenon (ancient site)
Update summary (the Parthenon was not the poliadic temple - that was the temple of Athena Polias in the Erechtheion)
